meanings.definition: The office or position of a praetor.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Rome, praetorships were prestigious roles held by respected individuals.
meanings.sent2: During the Roman Republic, praetorships were important governmental positions.
meanings.sent3: The competition for praetorships was fierce, with many candidates vying for the esteemed roles.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to justice made her praetorship a beacon of integrity in the community.
meanings.sent5: The responsibilities of a praetorship included upholding the law and ensuring fairness for all citizens.

meanings.definition: The term of office of a praetor.
meanings.sent1: His praetorship lasted for one year, during which he made significant legal decisions.
meanings.sent2: The praetorship of Marcus Aurelius was marked by peace and prosperity.
meanings.sent3: The end of his praetorship was celebrated with a grand feast in the city square.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set on his praetorship, he reflected on the impact he had made during his time in office.
meanings.sent5: The legacy of his praetorship continued to influence future leaders for generations to come.
